tr.td: For preserving Two Ships laden with Bay Salt taken as Prize for the Benefit of the Navy.

entry.head: Salt exported and imported See Excise.

tr.td:
Statute 22 & 23 Car. II. c. 23. for preventing Disturbance of Seamen and others, with some Alterations and Additions, to be in force for 7 Years, &c.
See Coal Ships.

entry.head: Seditious Books and Pamphlets See Books and Pamphlets.
Shadwell Water Company See London, City of.

tr.td:
Statute 13 & 14 Car. II. c. 21. for preventing unnecessary Charge of Sheriffs, and for Ease in passing their Accounts, made perpetual.
See Coin. Juries. London, City of.
For encouraging the building of Ships in England.
Foreign Ships henceforth carrying and employed in the Coasting Trade to pay 5s. per Ton for every Voyage, above other Duties.
The said Duty applied to the Chest at Chatham, and Trinity House at Deptford.
Foreign Ships already employed to pay 1s. per Ton above other Duties.
The said Duty applied as the 5s. Duty.
The said Duties recovered as by Stat. 12 Car.II.c. 4.
For building good and defensible Ships.

Coal Ships, Allowance of Seamen to.
See Raby and Dronance. Salt. Tonnage of Ships.

entry.head: Signing of Writs See Stamp Duties.

tr.td: Thrown Silk no Manufacture, within Stat. 12 Car. II. c. 18.
Proviso for Thrown Silk from Italy, imported on or before 1st Sept. 1690.

The like from India, on or before 20th Sept. 1691.
See 30 G. II.c. 17. § 1. exp. —43 G. III.c. 153. § 1, 2.—55 G.III.c. 8. § 2. c. 117. § 2.

For the Importation of fine Italian, Sicilian, and Naples Thrown Silk, during the present War with France, and Three Months longer.
See Customs.
That the Simoniacal Promotion of one Person may not prejudice another.
In what Case only, after the Death of Person simoniacally promoted, the Offence or Contract of Simony to prejudice others innocent of Simony.
Bonâ fide Leases by Simonists good.
For taking Special Bail in the Country upon Suits depending in the King's Courts at Westminster.
Chief Justices, &c. may make any Persons, other than Attorneys and Solicitors, Commissioners to take Bail in the Country.
Judges to receive Bail-piece upon Affidavit.
Such Bail to be of the same Effect as if taken de bene esse before a Judge.
Power to Judges to make Rules for justifying not ordering Appearance of Cognizor.
Proviso respecting Bail living in London, &c.
Justices of Assize may take Bail.

Persons being Bail in another's Name, Death.
This Section extended to the Court of Session of the C.P. of Chester, 27 G.III.c. 43. § 4. and to the Court of Common Pleas of the C.P. of Lancaster, 34 G.III.c. 46.
See Court of King's Bench.

For granting several Duties upon Parchment, Vellum, and Paper, for Four Years.
See 8 & 9 W. III.c. 20. § 1. the Duties continued until 1st August 1706. This Act recited, and the Duties repealed as to Admissions into Corporations and Companies, 5. G.III.c. 46. § 1. See, as to Licenses to Curates, 28 G. III.c. 28. § 1. repealed as to such of them as remained unrepealed, 44 G.III.c. 98. § 1. but Provisions continued as therein mentioned, § 8. See 48 G. III.c. 149. § 1–55 G. III.cc. 184, 185.
Officers of Courts to set down upon the Writ the Day and Year of signing, and enter it upon the Remembrance—Penalty £10.
Proviso for Probate of Will,&c. of Soldier and Seaman.
Place of Head Office; Commissioners may appoint Officers.

Six several Marks to be provided by Commissioners; Marks to be proclaimed, and may be changed.
Proclamation to be judicially noticed, 10 Ann. c. 19. § 180. Old Stamps to be used till new ones proclaimed in pursuance of this Act, 12 Ann. st. 2. c. 9. § 30.
Parchment, &c. to be stamped before written, and without Fee, except Duties.
Officer stamping before Duty paid— Penalty £100.

Writing upon Paper before stamped, or stamped, with too low a Duty—Penalty £500.
The above Penalty of £500 reduced to £5, 6 & 7 W. & M.c. 12. § 6. raised to £10, 9 W.III.c. 25. § 59.
No Instrument, &c. written before Paper stamped, &c. good, till £5 paid to the King, and Money for the Stamp.

Counterfeiting or selling counterfeit Stamp, Felony.
Persons causing or procuring to be forged Stamps, to suffer Death, 6 G.I.c. 21. § 60. See 52 G.III.c. 143. § 7. 55. G.III.c. 184. § 7. c. 185. § 6.
Commissioners may appoint Observers in every Court.
Judges may make Orders for securing Duties.
Officers to take an Oath—By whom administered.
Commissioners to observe the Orders of the Treasury, and to take care that all Parts of the Kingdom have Parchment, &c. at the usual Rates.
Records, &c. to be written as usual.
Upon Renewal of Marks, those that have Paper marked by them to have it changed within 60 Days — Penalty £100.
Paper not brought in within that Time of no Use.
Credit of Loan for £330,000 at £8 per Cent.

Proclamation of Renewal to be within 20 Days—Officers not publishing it, Penalty £200.
See Note to § 5.
The Auditor of the Imprest to take the Accounts of the Commissioners, &c. annually upon Oath—The Accounts declared before the Treasurer, &c.
Several Doubts, and the Duties and Penalties in Statute 5 & 6 W. & M.c. 21. explained and regulated.
Persons who have incurred the £500 Penalty of Statute 5 & 6 W. & M.c. 21. § 9. pardoned.
Prices of stamped Vellum, &c. to be annually set by the Treasury, and stamped.

Discount on ready Money at 6 per Cent.
Altered by many intermediate Acts, and a Discount at £1 10s. per Cent allowed, if not under £30 at one time, 44 G. III.c. 98. Schedule C.

entry.head: Standing Mute See Benefit of Clergy

head.key: States General of the United Probinces

tr.td: For appropriating certain Duties for paying the Charge of His Majesty's Expedition into this Kingdom.

Buyers, &c. of, knowing the same to be stolen, deemed Accessaries after the Fact.
This Act made perpetual, 6 & 7 W. III.c. 14. § 1.
Statute 22 & 23 Car. II. c. 23. for preserving the Stores belonging to the Navy Royal, with some Alterations and Additions, to be in force for 7 Years, &c.

entry.head: Straw See Weekly Bills of Mortality.

tr.td: Grant of £68, 820 19s: 1d. for One Month for Six Months, by Two Quarterly Payments.
Aid of 12d. in the Pound for One Year, for the Defence of the Realm.
Commissioners appointed for executing 1 W. & M.c. 20.

Grant to their Majesties of 2s. in the Pound for One Year.
Penalties, & c. in force 9 & 10 W. III.c. 44. § 88. and revived for the Purposes of that Act, 9 Ann.c. 21.§ 15.
— of an additional 12d. in the Pound for One Year.
For granting a Subsidy of Tonnage and Poundage, and other Sums of Money payable upon Merchandizes exported and imported.

Grant of 4s. in the Pound for One Year, for carrying on a vigorous War against France.
As to Assessment on Tenants of Hospitals, & c. see 4 G. III. c. 2. §26. and as to charging certain Parishes in Dover Liberty, see 4 G. III. c. 2. §77.

Grant to their Majesties Aid of 4s. in the Pound for One Year, for carrying on War with France.
See 8 & 9 W. III. c. 20. §1.
Grant to their Majesties of a Subsidy of Tonnage and Poundage, and other Sums of Money, payable upon Merchandizes exported and imported.

Grant to His Majesty of 4s. in the Pound for One Year, and for applying the yearly Sum of £300,000, for Five Years, out of the Duties of Tonnage and Poundage, &c.
See 8 & 9 W. III. c. 20. §1.
See Customs. Excise.

entry.head: Succession of the Crown See The Crown.

tr.td: Statute 17 Car. II. c. 8. for preventing unnecessary Suits and Delays, made perpetual.
For reviving of Actions and Process lately depending in the Courts at Westminster, and discontinued by the not holding of Hilary Term.
